abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is unsatisfactory,
            and sustainability is uncertain. Several lessons are drawn
            from the project, in particular, that project design was
            relatively complex, based on several broad ranging
            objectives, and components involving a number of Oyo State
            Government agencies. Although this operation was based on a
            standard design at the time, it is now suggested that
            simpler projects need to be designed in the future, without
            overestimating the capacity of weak administrative
            infrastructures. In addition, project objectives should be
            measurable, avoiding overly ambitious objectives. It appears
            that revenue generation remains a major difficulty for local
            governments (LG), hence, while the project enhanced the tax
            bases of several LGs, further major improvements are needed
            to realize additional revenues, through better billing, and
            collection practices. This remains relevant to state
            parastatals, such as the Solid Waste Management Authority in
            this project, which encountered difficulties in increasing
            rates due to cultural, political, and/or legal constraints.
            Hence, costs must be directly, or indirectly recovered, to
            ensure sustained provision of infrastructure services.
            Finally, all aspects of community involvement in
            infrastructure require equal emphasis, particularly as in
            this project, when at the early stages, increased demands
            led to decreased focus on the logistics of cost recovery.

repnme.cdata!:
Nigeria - Oyo State Urban Project - Second
            Infrastructure Development Fund (IDF II) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is designed to respond to
            the urgent need to break the vicious circle of financial and
            institutional constraints limiting the allocations for
            maintenace and infrastructure investments, which leads to
            inadequate urban services.  The main objectives are to
            promote the efficient functioning of Ibadan and Oyo
            State's other major towns through city-wide
            infrastructure rehabilitation, and through strengthening the
            institutions responsible for urban management and local
            resource mobilization.  Project components will consist of :
            a) infrastructure rehabilitation in Ibadan : a flood control
            program through channelization and maintenance of major
            storm drains; improved solid waste management; and
            integrated community improvement programs in 3 pilot areas;
            b) infrastructure improvements in selected LG towns and LG
            centers; c) revenue enhancement and institutional
            strengthening; and d) support to the Federal Ministry of
            Works and Housing (FMWH) for coordinating and monitoring
            project implementation.

docna.cdata!:
Nigeria - Oyo State Urban Project - Second
            Infrastructure Development Fund (IDF II) Project

display_title.display_title:

            - Second Infrastructure Development Fund (IDF II) Project
